Back out 6637 and 6639 until I do some more testing.  Even though all the mustella tests are passing I'm seeing some odd behavior.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Implement proxy model from SkinnableDataGroup in TextBase.  When the textView part is loaded, store all the properties in the textView.  When the textView part is unloaded, store them back in TextBase.  This eliminates the duplicate set of properties that were getting out of sync.  Text is the one exception to this since we only want to extract the text from the textFlow when it is absolutely necessary.
Fix misnamed tlf internal variable so pasting text with restrict, maxChars or displayAsPassword properties doesn't RTE.
QE Notes: all TextArea and TextInput tests pass except
Gumbo_TextInput_widthInChars_property_negative (passed in my test case so I need help from QA with this one)
Gumbo_TextInput_textView_widthInChars_5 (text needs to be revised since expected answer should be 5)
Gumbo_TextInput_textView_widthInChars_25 (test needs to be revised since expected answer should be 25)
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

RichEditableText and RichEditableText2 are now in the spark.primitives package rather than in spark.components, and RichEditableTextContainerManager is now in spark.primitives.supportClasses rather than in spark.components.supportClasses. This change means that SimpleText, RichText, and RichEditableText are now all together in spark.primitives. They are "primitives" because they aren't skinnable components, even though some extend GraphicElement and some extend UIComponent.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
1st pass of rename according to the spec http://opensource.adobe.com/wiki/display/flexsdk/Dropping+the+Fx+Prefix

Flex now requires CSS Style declarations to declare @namespace rules and disambiguate between halo and spark components using CSS 3 namespace prefixes on type selectors. At compile time, this namespace information will be used to map type names to qualified ActionScript class names. At runtime, type selectors are matched on qualified ActionScript class name (for example mx.controls.Button rather than just Button). Flex 3 applications must be compiled with -compatibility-version=3.0.0 to get unqualified CSS type selector behavior.
QE: Yes, this build may help in updating test cases to use the new namespaces and class names.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

1.  Implement autoSize in TextView (default=true), FxTextInput (defalt=false) and FxTextArea.as (default=false).  If linesBreaks are toFit, maxWidth and percentWidth can be used to control the width.  height, minHeight, maxHeight, percentHeight, width and minWidth are ignored.

2.  widthInChars changed to be width in ems (size of "M" in default font) even though the property hasn't been renamed yet. The default was changed from 20 to 15 for TextView, FxTextInput and FxTextArea.
3.  The heightInLines calculation was improved so it is much closer to what it would be if you actually measured the text.
4.  Removed showSelection/hideSelection from focusIn/Out handlers since they were no longer needed.  We've implemented the various selection formats now.
This will break a few mustella tests.
QE Notes: sent Peter D. notes on how autoSize works
Reviewers: Gordon and some testing by Peter D.
